item.description: 2022-10-04 Students can: Register for studies (matriculation) -> involves enrolling Enroll Withdraw Student receives certificate from student office.

item.title: CS2002 - Software Development
item.description: CS2002 Lecturer: Giuseppe Destefanis 50% Coursework (LO1 and LO2) -> Due on the 20th of January. 50% Exam. Lectures UML - Class Diagram (Week 2 and 3) UML - Sequence Diagram (Week 4 and 5) State Machine Diagrams (Part 1) (Week 8) State Machine Diagrams (Part 2) (Week 9) References UML @ Classroom - Chapter 3 (Use Case Diagram) (Week 1) Creating a Use Case Diagram

item.title: State Machine Diagrams - Part 1
item.description: Introduction Every object takes a finite number of different stages during its life. State machine diagrams are used as follows:

item.title: State Machine Diagrams - Part 2
item.description: Recap: A Simple State Composite State Also known as complex state or nested state. It contains other states, substates.

item.title: UML - Class Diagram
item.description: Objects Individuals of a system: Object Diagram The objects of a system and their relationships, snapshot of objects at a specific moment in time:

item.title: UML - Sequence Diagram
item.description: Inter-object behaviour: interactions between objects. Interaction: how data is exchanged between interaction partners. Interaction partners: - Human (lectures, administrator, …) - Non-human (sever, printer, executable software, …)

item.title: UML @ Classroom - Chapter 3 (Creating a Use Case Diagram)
item.description: This is continuation of my notes on Use Case Diagrams from the book UML @ Classroom. The first step is to identify actors and use cases and then place them in relationships with one another.

item.title: UML @ Classroom - Chapter 3 (Use Case Diagram)
item.description: Use Case Diagram Allows to describe the possible usage scenarios (use cases) that a system is developed for. Doesn’t address realisation details, for example data structures or algorithms.
